H3.text: who 's flag is red white and green. Hungary

A4.text: The Italian flag is a flag featuring three equally sized vertical pales of green, white and red, with the green at the hoist side.

A5.text: The Hungarian flag has the same colours as the Italian one, but on the Magyar banner the red, white and green tricolour is arranged horizontally.

A6.text: The Mexican tricolor (green, white, red) has been continuously used for a longer time than the Italian one.

A7.text: The flag is a vertical bicolour green-white-green design

A8.text: The red, white and green tricolour clearly emerged as a sign of national sovereignty during the 1848â€“1849 revolution against the Habsburgs.

A9.text: The official adoption of these colors was established by Act XXI of 1848, which for the first time mandated the use of the 'red-white-green' tricolor flag as a national symbol of Hungary.
